By Coach/Instructor Approval Only

Winter 2025 12 week schedule:
First week of classes: January 7 - January 12
Final week of classes: March 25 - March 30

This program encompasses the Cold Fusion and/or IceSYmmetrics adult synchronized skating teams.

Synchronized skating or "synchro" is a specialized discipline of skating involving groups of eight or more skaters performing various group formations and maneuvers. The objective is for the team to perform as one unit executing circles, blocks, lines, wheels and intersections in unison to the music, while demonstrating quality edges, power and flow

By Coach/Instructor Approval Only

Synchronized skating or "synchro" is a specialized discipline of skating involving groups of eight or more skaters performing various group formations and maneuvers. The objective is for the team to perform as one unit executing circles, blocks, lines, wheels and intersections in unison to the music, while demonstrating quality edges, power and flow

Note: Class time goes from 8:45am-9:30am.

PreHockey

This level teaches aspiring youth hockey players to learn to skate in hockey skates. All skaters that need skating aids (e.g. buckets or seals) should register for the Tiny Tot series before beginning PreHockey.

Class curriculum:
1) Ready Position
2) Forward Swizzles
3) Push and Glide
4) SnowPlow Stop
5) Moving Two Foot Jump
6) One Foot Glide (right)
7) One Foot Glide (Left)

Youth Hockey 1 - 2 - 3
These classes are open to children ages 6 and up and is an introductory class to the fundamentals of hockey skating. A skater should have already completed a skating class: Tiny Tots, PreHockey, Youth Beginner 1, or another comparable class at another rink to join the HOCKEY 1 class. Hockey 2 & 3 enrollment is contingent on completing the previous level.

For Hockey 1:

  • A proper hockey helmet, with a cage is required and a jersey of their choice is welcome.
  • No sticks allowed in Hockey 1. However based on the skill level improvement the use of a stick may be introduced at some point in the Hockey 1 series.
  • If you have full gear the skater is welcome to wear it.


FOR HOCKEY 2/3:

  • A proper hockey helmet, with a cage is required and full gear is required.

PreHockey

NOTE: No sticks or pucks are allowed on the ice during ice skating lessons.

Parent & Tot is a one hour skating session designed especially for our youngest tots. A 15-minute lesson will be offered each week and the rink will be set up with games and activities for you to play with your tot. The session is for 2–5-year-old skaters accompanied by one parent.

There are no refunds, make ups or credits for missed classes.

PLEASE DO NOT ENROLL IN A CLASS NOT APPROPRIATE TO YOUR LEVEL!

The adult curriculum is designed for beginning, intermediate and experienced adult skaters who wish to improve their skating skills. Participation in the program will help promote physical fitness and improve balance and coordination while teaching proper skating techniques. Group instruction includes a 30 minute class and 30 minute supervised practice,

Beginner 1 (Pre-Alpha equivalent) & Adult Beginner 1

1. Two foot glide

2. One-foot glide/ right foot/ left foot

3. Forward Swizzle

4. Backward Wiggle

5. Backward Swizzle

6. Forward Pumps

 

Beginner 2 (Alpha equivalent) & Adult Beginner 2

1. Forward Stroking

2. Forward Crossovers left over right (5)

3. Forward Crossovers right over left (5)

4. One foot snowplow stop

5. Two foot turn

 

Beginner 3 (Beta equivalent) & Adult Beginner 3

1. Backward Crossovers right over left (5)

2. Backward Crossovers left over right (5)

3. Backward Stroking (6)

4. Right T-Stop

5. Left T-Stop

6. Introduction to Forward Edges

 

Intermediate 1 (Gamma equivalent) & Adult Intermediate

1. Left Forward Outside 3-Turn

2. Right Forward Outside 3-Turn

3. Left Forward Inside Mohawk

4. Right Forward Inside Mohawk

5. Hockey Stop

6. Introduction to Backward Edges

 

 

Intermediate 2 (Delta equivalent) & Adult Intermediate

1. Left Forward Inside 3-Turn

2. Right Forward Inside 3-Turn

3. Forward Outside Edges

4. Forward Inside Edges

5. Lunge or Shoot the Duck

6. One-half Flip

 

Intermediate 3 (Freestyle 1 equivalent) & Adult Intro to Advanced

1. Backward outside edges

2. Backward inside edges

3. Two-foot spin

4. Forward spiral

5. Forward inside pivot

6. Waltz jump

 

Tuesday Adult Advanced

Taught by experienced coaches to cater to the desire of the class, The Tuesday Adult Advanced class goes beyong the fundamental skills of adult beginner and intermediate to learn advanced turns, changes of edge, spins, jumps, and sometimes choreographed step sequences.

Saturday "Full-ice" Adult Advanced

The Saturday Adult advanced class is a full-hour instructional class that begins with learning skating skills tests recognized by the governing bodies of figure skating. It then develops into fundamental skills mastery, learning advanced maneuvers such as spins or jumps, and skating to music. It is also open to special projects. This class prepares adults for skating beyond the learn to skate system and is applicable toward developing showcase, synchronized, and competitive skating.

Oakland Bears In-House Hockey Winter 2026!

Division 8 - Teams should consist of players that started hockey at an adult age, players that have participated in our Adult Hockey Clinic series, or equivalent experience.
